Additional Resources

Air Force Doctrine Document 2-4 Combat Support: AFDD 2-4 is the keystone document addressing the full spectrum of combat support functions that operate in peace and in war. It stresses the need for tailored combat support packages with the airmen, facilities, equipment, and supplies required for supporting aerospace forces.

afdd2_4.pdf

 

Air Force Policy Directive 23-5, Reusing and Disposing of Materiel: Disposal guidelines for the Air Force

AFPD 23-5

 

AMC: United States Air Force Headquarters Air Mobility Command Public Information Web Site

http://www.amc.af.mil

 

Defense Reutilization and Marketing Service Web Site: The place to obtain original US Government surplus property

http://www.drms.dla.mil/

 

Defense Demilitarization Manual: Current Demilitarization policy

http://www.dla.mil/dlaps/dod/416021m1/guide.asp

 

DoD Dictionary of Military Terms Web Site: The DoD Dictionary and the Joint Acronyms and Abbreviations master data base are managed by the Joint Doctrine Division, J-7, Joint Staff. All approved joint definitions are contained in Joint Publication 1-02, "DoD Dictionary of Military and Associated Terms." As amended through 17 December 2003.

http://www.dtic.mil/doctrine/dod_dictionary/

 

DoD Directive 5105.22: Updates the responsibilities, functions, relationships, and authorities of the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA)

DoD 5105.22 May 17, 2006

 

DoD Directive 5000.01: This Directive: 1. Reissues reference (a) and authorizes publication of reference (b). 2. Along with reference (b), provides management principles and mandatory policies and procedures for managing all acquisition programs.

DoDD 5000.01

 

DoD Instruction 5000.02: This Instruction: 1. Reissues reference (a) and cancels reference (b). 2. Implements reference (c), the guidelines of references (d) and (e), and current laws. 3. Establishes a simplified and flexible management framework for translating mission needs and technology opportunities, based on approved mission needs and requirements, into stable, affordable, and well-managed acquisition programs that include weapon systems and automated information systems (AISs). 4. Consistent with statutory requirements and reference (c), authorizes Milestone Decision Authorities (MDAs) to tailor procedures to achieve cost, schedule, and performance goals.

DoDI 5000.02

 

Geographic Command Areas Map: Organization of Combatant Commands

Unified Commands

 

Joint Doctrine Encyclopedia Web Site: from the Joint Electronic Library

http://www.dtic.mil/doctrine/jrm/ency.htm

 

Joint Pub 4-0, Doctrine for Logistics Support of Joint Operations: This publication is the keystone document of the logistic support of joint operations series. It provides doctrine for logistic support of joint and multinational (allied and coalition) operations.

jp4_0.pdf (3220 kb)

 

Joint Vision 2020: Joint Vision 2020 builds upon and extends the conceptual template established by Joint Vision 2010 to guide the continuing transformation of America's Armed Forces.

joint_vision_2020.pdf

 

MSC: Military Sealift Command Web Site

http://www.msc.navy.mil/

 

Operation of the Defense Acquisition System: DoDI 5000.02 (Operation of the Defense Acquisition System)reissues DoD Instruction 5000.2 to implement DoD Directive 5000.01, the guidelines of the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) Circular A-11, and the various laws, policy, and regulations listed in Enclosure 1 of this issuance.

500002p.pdf (457kb)

 

SDDC: Surface Deployment and Distribution Command (SDDC) Web Site

http://www.sddc.army.mil

 

The Defense Acquisition System: DoDD 5000.01 (The Defense Acquisition System), along with DoDI 5000.02 (Operation of the Defense Acquisition System), provides management principles and mandatory policies and procedures for managing all acquisition programs.

500001p.pdf (151kb)
